fields.summary: bulk change progress bar on a small number of tickets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41046].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 11 December 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

We expect a fix for this issue to be released in early January for both JIRA Cloud and JIRA Server.

We will update the current behavior to remove the association between Issue Worklogs and the Issue Updated event. This should resolve the problem originally described in this issue.

As I mentioned in my previous update, improving events and email notifications is part of the current JIRA roadmap. A number of you have indicated that there are existing challenges you face with JIRA email notifications beyond this issue. We would love to hear your feedback and suggestions – feel free to contact me directly.

Thanks,
Dave
Product Manager - JIRA Platform
{panel}

h4. Steps to reproduce
# Remove all log work notification
!1.png|thumbnail!
#* This is verified by the Notification Helper
!2.png|thumbnail!
# Have the user create an issue (PROA-4 in my test)
# As an admin, log work on the issue

h4. Expected Results
* No email notification received by reporter

h4. Actual Results
* Email is sent to reporter
!3.png|thumbnail!

h4. Additional
* When no notification is configured to send for work logged, email says *Admin updated an issue*
* When work logged is configured to send notification, email says *Admin added a worklog*
!4.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Logging work sends email even if not configured in notification scheme
500 error page is inappropriate for corporate environment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41043].
{panel}
When two issues are linked together in JIRA by one user, but the linked issue is not visible for a second user, then the issuekey of the linked issue still will be leaked to that second user, using the History Tab.

Steps to reproduce:
 - User A creates Issue 1. This issue is visible to User A and User B.
 - User A creates Issue 2. This issue is visible to User A and User C.
 - User A (who has rights on both issues), links issue 1 to issue 2.
 - Note that User B does not have any rights on the issue or project in witch issue 2 is created.
 - User C opens issue 2
 -- In the main view of the issue, no reference to Issue 1 is shown (this is correct)
 !01-No-links-visible.jpg|thumbnail!
 -- When the user clicks the History tab, there is a reference to Issue 1 (CSP-3 in the below screenshot). This is incorrect and should not be visible
 !02-Links-visible-in-issue-history.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Linked Issues displayed in History tab, regardless of permissons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41041].
  {panel}

h2. Symptom

CPU Usage high and potentially running into outofmemory error.

When generating thread dump, below stack is found:

{noformat}
"TP-Processor2" daemon prio=10 tid=0x4b897000 nid=0x46a3 runnable [0x4d48b000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
	at java.util.ResourceBundle.getClassContext(Native Method)
	at java.util.ResourceBundle.getLoader(ResourceBundle.java:400)
	at java.util.ResourceBundle.getBundle(ResourceBundle.java:822)
	at sun.util.resources.LocaleData$1.run(LocaleData.java:127)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at sun.util.resources.LocaleData.getBundle(LocaleData.java:125)
	at sun.util.resources.LocaleData.getDateFormatData(LocaleData.java:113)
	at java.text.DateFormatSymbols.cacheLookup(DateFormatSymbols.java:578)
	at java.text.DateFormatSymbols.initializeData(DateFormatSymbols.java:587)
	at java.text.DateFormatSymbols. (DateFormatSymbols.java:123)
	at java.text.DateFormatSymbols.getInstance(DateFormatSymbols.java:297)
	at java.text.SimpleDateFormat. (SimpleDateFormat.java:499)
	at java.text.SimpleDateFormat. (SimpleDateFormat.java:476)
	at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.Iso8601. (Iso8601.java:63)
	at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.Time. (Time.java:74)
	at net.fortuna.ical4j.model.DateTime. (DateTime.java:110)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ext.calendar.model.DateFieldProvider.getDate(DateFieldProvider.java:126)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ext.calendar.model.IssueComparator.compare(IssueComparator.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ext.calendar.model.IssueComparator.compare(IssueComparator.java:9)
{noformat}

Scanning the access logs which being served more than 60 seconds, potentially showing the call for the Calender:

{noformat}
awk '{ if ($11 > 60000000) print $0; }' /path/to/access_log

131.103.26.162 111.93.251.138 - [23/Nov/2014:07:10:54 +0530] "GET /rest/calendar-plugin/1.0/calendar/htmlcalendar.html?dateFieldName=customfield_10201&displayVersions=false&numOfIssueIcons=10&context=gadget&portletId=10286&includeContainer=true&searchRequestId=10157&_=1416706853400 HTTP/1.0" 200 49104 104464109 "<instance name>/plugins/servlet/gadgets/ifr?container=atlassian&mid=10286&country=US&lang=en&view=default&view-params=%7B%22writable%22%3A%22false%22%7D&st=atlassian%3AYasv4X6Y%2BcC2C2r2ihAQukEYqqp6x8QJ65Rk5GQUxM6pDjgF8FjgQVgGehSkmSzGieCE19cHKm%2FLsanNHGOy2BV7LrS2JJ%2BcRyC%2FUrOOI%2BvzG1K9OeLZb0Hcc5ejYeQSCMN7qVYKzu0R6qZelv0nP%2F5ruFAxc3J9lXaSuFcI1WsujoWYgBIVE2HzOkQWm0fIEBpjuTjFcmWvp%2B8Uos0S%2F%2FtNjyWAh1BXTJB6D3Y9KqJKBkJLKXgHO0gB6FZBSkK4k635F%2FUKLx0s5VrJfh8Hl3gdG1Cqcx6MwzlGO4O%2F1Km4zgU5%2B28nUBimuLPdlJdEGPxSLwztoDzuR5351pjqPUsvT1Sog8Z7m7%2BdTXgom5CYCJM2donoowZH9r3n7z4ycc5iQbtWM1FLVWtyiP0rcsYWWA0Q3HEMoeyNO094H7o1U%2BaFgNPfT8eckCqToBrHHulqSw%3D%3D&up_isConfigured=true&up_projectOrFilterId=filter-10157&up_dateFieldName=customfield_10201&up_displayVersions=false&up_numOfIssueIcons=10&up_refresh=15&url=https%3A%2F%2F<instance name>t%2Frest%2Fgadgets%2F1.0%2Fg%2Fcom.atlassian.jira.ext.calendar%3Aissuescalendar-gadget%2Ftemplates%2Fplugins%2Fjira%2Fportlets%2Fcalendar%2Fgadget%2Fcalendar-gadget.xml&libs=auth-refresh" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.2; WOW64; rv:19.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/19.0"
{noformat}

h2. Cause: 

The Calender Gadget retrieving all the issues and attempts to compare the date to render the result. 

Tested using a vanilla instance, generated 30k issues with 30k custom field (date time) and added a Calender to show. It spikes the CPU usage and took more than 5 seconds to complete rendering the data. Imagine the impact for a busy instances, a bad combination could result on constant GC and CPU consistently high.

h2. Workaround

To down size the filter by adding the created date clause to reduce the number returned. Or remove the gadget to check if this is the primary cause of the issue.
fields.summary: The Calendar Gadget can cause high CPU and memory usage for large filters
Ability to search for issues that were moved

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41035].
  {panel}

Steps:
# Go to issue nav (/issues)
# Perform any search
# Issue table doesn't fade out whilst the search is in progress

Bug only occurs in list view. Details view still has the fading.

This used to be a feature in JIRA 6.0 (Maybe 6.1), but no longer the case in master today.
fields.summary: List view doesn't fade the issue table when performing a search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41033].
  {panel}

Images taken with rotated cameras, iPhones etc. are displayed without compensation for that rotation. This means users have to rotate the image and save it in another program before attach it Jira in order to have the image displayed as expected. Images contain EXIF information that will allow Jira to do this rotation for the users automatically.

When you view the image in issue view, the image will be up side down.
However when you view the image at the image directory for example : https://stan.jira-dev.com/secure/attachment/10001/IMG_7275.JPG

The browser will show the image in the correct orientation.
fields.summary: Support EXIF orientation so that images are displayed with the expected orientation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41023].
  {panel}

I have a JIRA query on specific issues and have setup a dashboard in Confluence. I want to get alerted if there are any changes to the numbers/states for the issues in the query. 

Eg.
- Alert when the number returned by the query is now changed to 14 from 13. Likewise when it goes down
- Alert when one of the issues under the query goes from UnAssigned to Assigned or from ToDo to Done (or any other status change).

How do I do it?
fields.summary: How do I get alerts for a JIRA query
Notificaciones para estado Incidencia Resuelta con Valor de campo personalizado de usuario

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41021].
  {panel}

# Edit a Workflow.
# Go to Diagram mode.
# Select a Status to edit.
# A popup box appears giving editing options for the Status.
# There should be a checkbox for the option "Allow all statuses to transition to this one" - Select it.
# A transition is now created in every Status for that Status type. This includes itself.

!image.png|thumbnail!

Once the "Allow all statuses..." has been set, you cannot delete the single transition to self while keeping the remaining useful transitions. Additionally since this setting is redundant, it also takes up space in the button bar which could be better used for other more relevant buttons.
fields.summary: Allow all statuses to transition to this one option allows transition to self

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41007].
  {panel}

If I run a search from the input box on:
https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/Dashboard.jspa

And it has spaces in the search temr, e.g. "some bug card", the URL it directs my browser to is:
https://www.atlassian.com/search.action?query=some+bug+card

Which then shows the "+" signs in the search box.  If I replace the "+"s with spaces and hit search on this page, I now get directed to:
https://www.atlassian.com/search.action?query=some%20bug%20card

Which appears to work correctly.

I suspect the dashboard is using incorrect character escaping when building the URL to redirect to.
fields.summary: jira dashboard does not escape spaces properly for atlassian search page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41006].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour

JIRA/Confluence some times need to scale the original size of the global logo. The resultant size may differ by using oversized or undersized images. To reproduce, just upload a custom logo to both JIRA and Confluence via global logo admin section respectively.

See the inconsistencies between JIRA and Confluence using the [attached logo|^Atlassian-ondemand-logo.png]. 

JIRA: 
!JIRA.png!

Confluence:
!Confluence.png!

It could be well related to the constraint set by both apps. These info messages are displayed on the global logo upload page:

* JIRA: "The height of the logo image will be constrained to a maximum of 30 px. Also, it is recommended to use an image with a 57 px width."
* Confluence: "The height of the logo image will be constrained to a maximum of 48 px."

This is verified on Chrome, Safari, Firefox.

h3. Feature Request

Ensure consistency of the global logo size across all apps. This is important for branding.
fields.summary: Consistent global logo size across JIRA and Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41002].
  {panel}

As more and more people use Jira for non-development purposes many of us have 100's of shared filters.

At the moment the fact that you have to individually go into each filter to update permissions makes this very unmaintainable and can take hours to make these changes.

Please could you implement:-

1) Capability to select multiple filters and edit permissions
fields.summary: Unable to bulk edit shared filter permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-41000].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a connector type/delegated LDAP directory
# Change to {{"ldap.user.username": "cn"}}
# Setup a user with multiple cn attribute, for example: _usera_, _userb_, _userc_
# Perform synchronisation
# Login using _usera_, _userb_, _userc_

*Actual Behaviour*
Only the first cn can be login

*Expected Behaviour*
All cn user suppose to be able to login
fields.summary: Support multiple cn login for LDAP users
Links/titles of dialogs in issue view are not compatible with ADG
Publish or Discard Draft message should also be shown in the Workflow Properties edit screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40997].
  {panel}

This seems to be caused by the bugfix for: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-40310

In 6.3.9 and later, you can no longer add a comment in a transition screen if the destination status has {{jira.permission.comment.user}} set to {{false}} or {{denied}}. The message below is displayed in a red banner when you try to transition the issue:
_<username>, you do not have the permission to comment on this issue._

This should not be the case because the comment permission property should be based on the CURRENT status of the issue. To put it in simply, the transition was not yet executed so adding a comment should be allowed.
fields.summary: Cannot add comment in transition screen if destination status has jira.permission.comment.user set to false

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40994].
  {panel}

Ability to search on issues that were last commented by a specific group


h3. Current Behaviour
Currently there is no option available to filter issues that were last commented by a specific group 

h3. Feature Request
Ability to search on issues that were last commented by a specific group. Additionaly,  ability to search for group that first commented in JIRA issues.
fields.summary: Ability to search on issues that were last commented by a specific group
JIRA v6.4-OD-09-008 On Demand Version - Issues observed in Dash board while using two dimensional filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40990].
  {panel}

The changelog should be more customizable than it is atm. One basic idea from a users point of view would be to be able to add filters to changelogs. This would cover a bunch of requested usecases to customize the changelog page.

In my case I only want to display external issues in the changelog (aka: those which can be seen by users and are not internal bugs/issues which do not directly surface to the user).
For that I've added a custom field ("Is user visible") which is being set for issues which should be contained in the changelog.

If I could set a filter for the changelog, that'd be all I need so that internal issues are not listed on the changelog page.

Other usecases which could be done with this approach:
- only list issues with a priority >= major in the list
- exclude subtasks from the changelog
- do not list tasks in the changelog
- etc.
fields.summary: Using filters to create changelogs.
Clone issue should give you the option to change the 'issue link type'
As a user of the issue navigator, I want to use "pseudo" fields such as "Linked Reviews, "Linked Changesets" etc. to be able to add developent panel contents to query results.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40982].
  {panel}

There is a mismatch between Closing an Epic and marking it as Done.
In my opinion either of the two should automatically do the other.

I can't mark a Closed Epic as Done anymore, since our Closed issues are read-only. This means I have to reopen (Issue View) -> mark as done (Agile View) -> close (Issue View). This is not very user-friendly and people tend to forget to Mark as Done anyway.

After I Mark as Done, the Epic no longer shows up in the Epic lists, so if it isn't Closed automatically, these issues are difficult to track down. They will show up in simple open/closed statistics, skewing results.
fields.summary: Closing Epic does not mark it as Done
Set Default Subtask Issue Type
Link broken on Google Apps Integration FAQ
incomplete stories get moved to another sprint instead of a top of backlog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40974].
  {panel}

The ability introduced in JIRA 6.2.x to allow users (not just admins) to import from .CSV files really needs some other limiting factor beyond "Create Issue" project permission and "Bulk Edit" global permission.  Importing is not the same as bulk editing.

Importing via .CSV can easily go wrong spawning tons of errors, especially for those who have little experience formatting them.  This can cause all types of problems throughout the entire JIRA instance.  And while most users would like the ability to import issues as it is an easier way for them to enter issues, most either will not take the time to correctly format their import, read how to do so or pre-test the import before they do so.  This can be very, very bad.

So personally, as my companies system administrator, I have to make the choice of taking the risk to allow them this function (since they require the "Create Issue" ability in their own projects and they use Bulk Editing, turn off bulk editing which they have used for 2 1/2 years, or not upgrade above the 6.1.x series.  At present, only the latter is a viable solution.

Please add additional abilities for system administrators to limit the use of bulk importing (like it's own global permission setting)
fields.summary: "Import Issues" function should have additional permission requirements
Provide JIRA resource returning issues filtered by worklogDate in JQL query
Ability to perform searches using just "["
Add a CANCEL button to Announcement Banner

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40967].
  {panel}

I'd like to be able to set a JIRA ticket field value to the commit hash of the commit I annotate.  Or at least mention the commit hash in a comment.

e.g.
JRA-123 #setField <FieldName> #hash
or
JRA-123 #close Fixed in commit #hash
fields.summary: Improved processing of JIRA issues with commit messages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40958].
  {panel}

The workflow image is normally displayed when using Firefox and Chrome.
Many of our customers still use IE8 mainly.
With JIRA 6.2, the workflow image is displayed normally when using Firefox and Chrome,　but sometimes its layout is broken such as elements are overlapping each other when using IE8.
Are there any way to modify the layout of workflow image for IE8?
We only know that the workflow images are read from <JIRA home　directory>/caches/workflowimages/<Workflow's name>/xxx.png.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40946].

Currently, to delete a dashboard, you have to:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40943].
  {panel}

*Custom field definitions:* 
- 20022 = 07.2014
- 20031 = 11.2014

*There will be only shown the ids of the fields:*
{code}
<customfield id="customfield_10511" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multiversion">
<customfieldname>Delivery Version</customfieldname>
<customfieldvalues>
<customfieldvalue>20022</customfieldvalue>
<customfieldvalue>20031</customfieldvalue>
</customfieldvalues>
</customfield>
{code}

*Should be:*
{code}
<customfield id="customfield_10511" key="com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:multiversion">
<customfieldname>Delivery Version</customfieldname>
<customfieldvalues>
<customfieldvalue>07.2014</customfieldvalue>
<customfieldvalue>11.2014</customfieldvalue>
</customfieldvalues>
</customfield>
{code}
fields.summary: XML issue export returns the custom field id rather than the value for multiversion custom fields
Images with very large dimensions cause thumbnail generation to OOME the instance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40939].
  {panel}

Our organisation has using JIRA for issue logging for few years now.  Due to the nature of issue logging, business need to produce monthly, qtrly report, type of report also have business unit breakdow, like unresolved issues are older than 3 months by each business unit.  
When we have internal restructure, all those queries/filters are broken, because the queries/filters use specific custom field (those custom field are selected list).  We have total over  50+ filters built with those custom fields.  
If will be great if there is a varible function can be use in filters.

More details can refer to JSP-202890 ticket.
fields.summary: Use variables when building filters for JIRA reports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40938].
  {panel}

The image preview from within a JIRA issue persists even after the user has clicked the back button in their browser (see attached image from our own JIRA project displaying this behavior).

Steps:
1. As authenticated user, view any issue type with an image attachment
2. Click image attachment to prompt the preview modal to appear
3. Click back button in browser
4. Observe that browser takes you back to previous page, but the image preview persists on screen
fields.summary: Issue's image popup persists on screen after clicking back button

Details

After perform the "View as Wallboard" action in a JIRA Dashboard that contains a Pie Chart, the loaded page where the Pie Chart is shown will prompt an error on the screen to the user as follows:

!wallboard.png|thumbnail!

This is also affecting JIRA Dashboard that does not contain Pie Chart. It is also affecting other gadget.

Reuse of custom fields for performance and maintainability

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40931].
  {panel}

When a non-admin user performs a CSV import, it is not possible to map the Reporter, or other fields such as Parent ID, to import sub-tasks.

It would be really useful if our documentation about CSV importer:

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Creating+issues+using+the+CSV+importer

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+issues+using+the+CSV+importer

Could explain which fields cannot be mapped in the CSV import for non-admin users.
fields.summary: explain which fields non-admins can map during csv import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*Atlassian update on June 21st*

Hi everyone, thanks so much for your suggestions.

You can now see a new *dropdown box* that allows users to sort issues under *epic issues* (company managed projects) and *child issues* (team managed projects). The following sort options could be available to you, based on your specific project setup:
 * Created (most recent first)

 * Key (alphabetically then numerically)

 * Priority (same order specified in the global admin - only available when the “parent issue” also has the priority field visible)

 * Status (first by status category - to do, in progress, then done - and then alphabetically

 * Assignee (alphabetically then unassigned)

 * Default (current order, “ranking” - for example, what was set in a board)

*Atlassian Product Team*
{panel}
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40929].
{panel}
Today we don't have the ability to reorder the Issues in Epic when viewing a ticket.
 It would be great if we can rank them like we do with the Sub-Tasks (see attached).

Also, it would be helpful to have a header column to the "Issues in this epic" section of an epic where the users could sort by issue key, ID, or summary
fields.summary: Ability to change the order of the Issues in Epic

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40928].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour
In the Dashboard Chart, when you click on the chart it will go to the issue navigator of the saved filter used containing the filter ID.

!Filter.png|thumbnail!

h3. Feature Request
In the Dashboard Chart, when you click on the chart it will go to the issue navigator of the saved filter used but should show the actual JQL clause not the filter ID.
fields.summary: Dashboard Chart should show actual JQL clause not the Filter ID
Possibly outdated information in https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-seraph

Thanks and Regards,

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40919].
  {panel}

#* see a dashboard with no gadgets
#* see a Log In link that does nothing

fields.summary: User in no groups cannot either log in or log out
Ability to view PDF, Word, and Excel Attachments Inline
Enable to search issues by special characters
As a JIRA Admin, I would like a way to set up automatic license renewals.
Who's Looking plugin compatible with latest versions
REST API User Impersonation
Support http basic auth for JIRA webhooks
Support webhooks to ports other than 443 and 80
Remove user parameters from Webhook URL
Clarify Migrating from JIRA Cloud Documentation
Add ability to create users without sending them emails.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40901].
  {panel}

Here is an extremely common use case that is not covered properly by JIRA or Confluence user picket fields:

If you copy the email contact from an email client, like Microsoft Outlook, you will end-up with something like this in the clipboard: "John Doe <john.doe@acme.com>"

If you paste this value in the user picker, it will not find you the contact even if the username and the email address do both match perfectly. 

If you paste only email address or only username it does work, but the entire idea is to make it work without having to edit the text.

I would even see it as an acceptable use to search only by email address if you paste a text formatted like the one above. The test above is the default format for email addresses, as in mail RFCs.

Think about this, is a minor code change that would increase user experience considerably.
fields.summary: Jira user pickup does not work with pasted email contacts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40900].
  {panel}

If a workflow is missing the transition : 
"Set issue status to the linked status of the destination workflow step."

then after executing the transition on the issue, the issue status would not be updated. This is un-intuitive as its not clear for the user. I believe JIRA should give warning messages if a workflow transition is not updating the issue status.

PS: I believe this post-function is present by default, however I saw an instance today where it wasn't present. I am not sure how it got to that state.
fields.summary: Issue workflow status not updated after transition execution

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40899].
  {panel}

The workflow image is normally displayed when using Firefox and Chrome.
Many of our customers mainly use IE8.
The workflow image's layout of the issue is broken in JIRA 6.2.7.
*  Can we modify the layout of workflow image?
*  We'd like to know the logic which displayed the workflow image in this environment.

We only know that the workflow images are read from <JIRA home directory>/caches/workflowimages/<Workflow's name>/xxx.png.
fields.summary: In IE8 and JIRA ver.6.2.7, how is the layout of the workflow image be configured?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40896].
  {panel}

Deleting custom image for project avatar will cause NPE for Edit Project.
{noformat}
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.project.EditProject.doDefault(EditProject.java:67)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:70)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:56)
{noformat}

*Steps to reproduce*:
# Create a project
# Click on *Edit* for the project from projects list in administration - https://<domain>/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa
# Click *select image* - upload a custom image for avatar and update/save
# Edit the project again by clicking *Edit* in project list and *select image*
# Delete the custom image by hovering the cursor on it and click *X* at the top right of the image. Close the *select image* dialogue
# Click *Update*
# The project avatar now is changed to Atlassian's Charlie instead of default rocket or broken image in project's administration page. Editing the project will throw NPE error

*Expected behavior*
The project's avatar should be set to default one(rocket icon).

*Workaround*
The project's avatar ID need to be updated from database and restart JIRA. For Atlassian OnDemand users, please create a support ticket at https://support.atlassian.com under *OnDemand Support* project to get this fixed.
fields.summary: Deleting custom image for project avatar will cause NPE for Edit Project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40892].
  {panel}

The advanced issue filter in JIRA is using the project name when selecting 'Project'. When the project name is changed this leads to the filter breaking .
When using the basic filter and selecting a project via the dropdown the key is correctly used instead of the name.

We are changing project names, but usually keep the project key fixed. The means that advanced filters using the project will break.

I would like to change this default behavior to use project key in basic and in advanced search. I don't see any benefit in using the project name in advanced search.
fields.summary: JIRA Default behaviour for advanced filter should use project key instead of name

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40891].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When the user have the profile language in Japanese and he tries to add a date on the "Activity Stream Gadget" using the calendar function it looks like automatically add a non needed double byte value, on this case "月" that means "month" And is causing the error of the attached images, and the user is unable to select/save the specific date.
Even typing on the correct format is not possible to save it.

----------
The error if translated to english says：
入力した日付は無効です。推奨する書式は "2014/11月/14" です。
The date you entered is invalid. The recommended format is "2014/11 月 / 14".
----------

If the user changes the profile language to other language it works fine.
This was reproduced on the following versions of JIRA:
JIRA Server
6.2.7, 6.3.8, 6.3.10
JIRA Cloud
6.4-OD-09-008

h3. Workaround
- Delete '月' character and hit 'Enter' key (see [Workaround.jpg|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/171959/WorkAround.jpg] also)
fields.summary: Activity stream gadget calendar filter date selection "double byte language" error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40889].
  {panel}

I can't change the type of an issue from the edit screen. The message says "There are no issue types with compatible field configuration and/or workflow associations."

Currently, the definition of "compatible workflow" is "identical".

This is unnecessarily strict, and creates lots of overhead.

----

In my case, the workflows are almost exactly the same. They differ only in a few details, like when screens are used.

Changing the issue involves a lot of worthless steps, with only one real decision.

*Step 1:* choose the new type
*Step 2:* worthless
*Step 3:* worthless
*Step 4:* worthless

When only the type changes (status and fields staying the same), I should be able to do this without clicking through a bunch of screens. It's unnecessarily counterintuitive to my users, and it's tedious for me. 

----

If changing workflows is a dangerous action (I don't think it is), a confirmation dialog could say "This will change the issue workflow from A to B".

If changing workflows is a high-permission action (I don't think it is), it could be restricted to those with the "Move" permission.
fields.summary: Simplify changing issue type with different workflows
JIRA Activity Stream Gadget FIlter

fields.description:
Hi,

we have a custom status "Planned". The workflow is the following: Open -> Planned. In this direction all works as should. But when I want to revert planning (Planned -> Open), JIRA raises an error:

<<
Workflow Error

Unable to update custom field customfield_10115 - Date Planned in issue [CS-1396].

It seems that you have tried to perform an illegal workflow operation.

If you think this message is wrong, please contact your JIRA administrators.
>>
I'm an administrator of JIRA. How can I solve it?

BR
Valeriy KHISAEV
fields.summary: Workflow Error on updating a custom field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40872].
  {panel}

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Check if in Bitbucket, you have some issues that have the status set to *closed*
# Go to the *External System Import* and choose *Import from Bitbucket*
# Follow the wizard, map the repository to a project and go on. 
# When the import begins, it will error out:
{noformat}
2014-11-14 15:32:47,881 ERROR - Error importing issue ExternalIssue{externalId=1, summary=Testing, issueType=1}
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.external.ExternalException: Unable to create issue: Testing
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ExternalUtils.createIssue(ExternalUtils.java:194)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.createIssue(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:896)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importIssues(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:764)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.doImport(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:390)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:307)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:58)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:62)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invokeUnprivileged(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:56)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invoke(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:39)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.osgi.service.importer.support.LocalBundleContextAdvice.invoke(LocalBundleContextAdvice.java:59)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:131)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:119)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:171)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:204)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy2540.doImport(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:15)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:527)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:490)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ForkedThreadExecutor$ForkedRunnableDecorator.run(ForkedThreadExecutor.java:253)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:744)
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.external.ExternalException: Cannot find status with id 'closed'.
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ExternalUtils.checkStatus(ExternalUtils.java:214)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ExternalUtils.createIssue(ExternalUtils.java:183)
	... 33 more
{noformat}

h5. Expected results

You should be able to import, the status exists in JIRA.
fields.summary: Unable to Import Project from Bitbucket
different work log interaction between issue and subtask
JQL documentation for searching Labels field
Colored Labels
\(1\+1\) and "\\[example\\]" are not good as an example

fields.description:
1) Create bug
2) Close bug, write close reason in "comment" box on close dialog.
3) Realise close reason was intended for different bug
4) Kick self
5) Try to delete new "comment" (close reason)
6) Realise you cannot
7) Kick Atlassian

You should be able to edit bugs (delete comments, edit comments, undo closing [not the same as re-opening!]) without adding more history.
fields.summary: Cannot delete comment
Request for nextUnreleasedVersion(ProjectName, N) in JQL
Renaming the user should also update filters and mentions

fields.description:
Hi Team,

To my knowledge, I believe that once a JIRA Ticket is closed, it cannot be reopened. 

The Tool Tip on Closed says otherwise.

+ Attached Screenshot

Best,
Swapnil Gandhi
fields.summary: Bug with JIRA Tool Tips

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40839].
  {panel}

We make heavy use of epics. I frequently find my self wanting to do searches like, find all the epics with:

 - issues in the current sprint
 - issues assigned to user x (or group of users)
 - issues in workflow status x
 - issues with label y
 - issues with custom field z
 - etc.
fields.summary: Allow JQL search for epics based on issues within them
